This interface describes a parcel resource and all the operations that can

ApiActivity.title: ApiActivity

name.description: Activity name.

type.description: Activity type. Whether it's an MR job, a Pig job, a Hive query, etc.

parent.description: The name of the parent activity.

startTime.description: The start time of this activity.

finishTime.description: The finish time of this activity.

id.description: Activity id, which is unique within a MapReduce service.

user.description: The user who submitted this activity.

inputDir.description: The input data directory of the activity. An HDFS url.

outputDir.description: The output result directory of the activity. An HDFS url.

queueName.description: The scheduler queue this activity is in.

schedulerPriority.description: The scheduler priority of this activity.

ApiActivity.description:
Represents a user activity, such as a MapReduce job, a Hive query, an Oozie
workflow, etc.

ApiAddCustomCertsArguments.title: ApiAddCustomCertsArguments

location.description:
The location on disk to store the CMCA directory. If there is already a CMCA created there,
it will be backed up, and a new one will be created in its place.

interpretAsFilenames.description:
Whether the following arguments are interpreted as filenames local to the Cloudera Manager
host (true, default) or as the actual data for that argument:
* hostCerts.hostCert
* hostCerts.hostKey

If HTTPS has not been enabled on the Cloudera Manager Admin Console and API, we
*strongly* recommend that you pass the arguments as filenames local to the Cloudera Manager
host (i.e. set to true) to avoid leaking sensitive information over the wire in plaintext.

hostCerts.description:
A list of HostCertInfo objects, which associate a hostname with the corresponding
certificate and private key. Only used if customCA == true.

ApiAddCustomCertsArguments.description: Arguments to add custom certificates to the Auto-TLS certificate database

ApiAudit.title: ApiAudit

timestamp.description: When the audit event was captured.

service.description: Service name associated with this audit.

username.description: The user who performed this operation.

impersonator.description:
The impersonating user (or the proxy user) who submitted this operation.
This is usually applicable when using services like Oozie or Hue, who
can be configured to impersonate other users and submit jobs.

ipAddress.description: The IP address that the client connected from.

resource.description: The resource that the operation was performed on.

operationText.description:
The full text of the requested operation. E.g. the full Hive query.

Available since API v5.

allowed.description: Whether the operation was allowed or denied by the authorization system.

ApiAudit.description:
Models audit events from both CM and CM managed services like HDFS, HBase
and Hive. Audits for CM managed services are retrieved from Cloudera Navigator
server.

ApiAuthRole.title: ApiAuthRole

baseRole.description:
A role this user possesses. In Cloudera Enterprise Datahub Edition, possible values are:
  • ROLE_ADMIN
  • ROLE_USER
  • ROLE_LIMITED: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.0
  • ROLE_OPERATOR: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.1
  • ROLE_CONFIGURATOR: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.1
  • ROLE_CLUSTER_ADMIN: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.2
  • ROLE_BDR_ADMIN: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.2
  • ROLE_NAVIGATOR_ADMIN: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.2
  • ROLE_USER_ADMIN: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.2
  • ROLE_KEY_ADMIN: Added in Cloudera Manager 5.5
An empty role implies ROLE_USER.

uuid.description: Readonly. The UUID of the authRole.

ApiAuthRole.description:
This is the model for user role scope in the API since v18.
This is used to support granular permissions.

ApiAuthRoleAuthority.title: ApiAuthRoleAuthority

name.description: The name of the authority.

ApiAuthRoleAuthority.description:
This represents an authority with a name
and description.

ApiAuthRoleMetadata.title: ApiAuthRoleMetadata
ApiAuthRoleMetadata.description: This is the model for auth role metadata

ApiAuthRoleMetadataList.title: ApiAuthRoleMetadataList
ApiAuthRoleMetadataList.description: A list of auth roles metadata.

ApiAuthRoleRef.title: ApiAuthRoleRef

displayName.description:
The display name of the authRole.
displayName is optional. If a changed displayName is passed
in, it will be ignored.

name.description:
The name of the authRole.
name is available from v32. It is optional, and cannot be
modified. Name takes precedence over uuid. If name is absent,
uuid will be used for look up.

uuid.description: The uuid of the authRole, which uniquely identifies it in a CM installation.

ApiAuthRoleRef.description: An authRoleRef to operate on ApiAuthRole object

ApiBatchRequest.title: ApiBatchRequest
ApiBatchRequest.description: A batch request, comprised of one or more request elements.

ApiBatchRequestElement.title: ApiBatchRequestElement

method.description: The type of request (e.g. POST, GET, etc.).

url.description:
The URL of the request. Must not have a scheme, host, or port. The path
should be prefixed with "/api/", and should include path and query
parameters.

body.description:
Optional body of the request. Must be serialized in accordance with
#getContentType(). For application/json, use
com.cloudera.api.ApiObjectMapper.

contentType.description:
Content-Type header of the request element. If unset, the element will be
treated as if the wildcard type had been specified unless it has a body,
in which case it will fall back to application/json.

acceptType.description:
Accept header of the request element. The response body (if it exists)
will be in this representation. If unset, the element will be treated as
if the wildcard type had been requested.

ApiBatchRequestElement.description:
A single element of a batch request, often part of a list with other
elements.

ApiBatchResponse.title: ApiBatchResponse

success.description:
Read-only. True if every response element's
ApiBatchResponseElement#getStatusCode() is in the range [200, 300),
false otherwise.

ApiBatchResponse.description: A batch response, comprised of one or more response elements.

ApiBatchResponseElement.title: ApiBatchResponseElement

statusCode.description: Read-only. The HTTP status code of the response.

response.description:
Read-only. The (optional) serialized body of the response, in the
representation produced by the corresponding API endpoint, such as
application/json.

ApiBatchResponseElement.description:
A single element of a batch response, often part of a list with other
elements.

ApiBulkCommandList.title: ApiBulkCommandList

errors.description: Errors that occurred when issuing individual commands.

ApiBulkCommandList.description:
A list of commands.

This list is returned whenever commands are issued in bulk, and contains a second list with information about errors issuing specific commands.

ApiCdhUpgradeArgs.title: ApiCdhUpgradeArgs

cdhParcelVersion.description:
If using parcels, the full version of an already distributed
parcel for the next major CDH version. Default is null, which
indicates this is a package upgrade. Example versions are:
'5.0.0-1.cdh5.0.0.p0.11' or '5.0.2-1.cdh5.0.2.p0.32'

cdhPackageVersion.description:
If using packages, the full version of the CDH packages being upgraded to, such as "5.1.2". These packages must already be installed on the cluster before running the upgrade command. For backwards compatibility, if "5.0.0" is specified here, then the upgrade command will relax validation of installed packages to match v6 behavior, only checking major version.

Introduced in v9. Has no effect in older API versions, which assume "5.0.0"

rollingRestartArgs.description:
If provided and rolling restart is available, will perform rolling restart with the requested arguments. If provided and rolling restart is not available, errors. If omitted, will do a regular restart.

Introduced in v9. Has no effect in older API versions, which must always do a hard restart.

deployClientConfig.description:
Not used starting in v9 - Client config is always deployed as part of
upgrade. For older versions, determines whether client configuration
should be deployed as part of upgrade. Default is true.

startAllServices.description:
Not used starting in v9 - All servies are always started as part of
upgrade. For older versions, determines whether all services should be
started should be deployed as part of upgrade. Default is true.

ApiCdhUpgradeArgs.description: Arguments used for the CDH Upgrade command.

ApiCertificateRequest.title: ApiCertificateRequest

hostname.description: Get the hostname of the host requesting certificates

csr.description: Get the certificate signing request in PEM format

ApiCertificateRequest.description:
This API class represents a request to retrieve Auto-TLS certificates for a
given host. The request contains the host requesting the certificate, a
valid token generated by the certmanager utility, and optionally a
certificate signing request.

Currently, the certificate signing request argument is not supported.

ApiCluster.title: ApiCluster

name.description:
The name of the cluster.

Immutable since API v6.

Prior to API v6, will contain the display name of the cluster.

displayName.description:
The display name of the cluster that is shown in the UI.

Available since API v6.

version.description: The CDH version of the cluster.

fullVersion.description:
The full CDH version of the cluster. The expected format is three dot separated version numbers, e.g. "4.2.1" or "5.0.0". The full version takes precedence over the version field during cluster creation.

Available since API v6.

maintenanceMode.description:
Readonly. Whether the cluster is in maintenance mode.
Available since API v2.

maintenanceOwners.description:
Readonly. The list of objects that trigger this cluster to be in
maintenance mode.
Available since API v2.

services.description: Optional. Used during import/export of settings.

parcels.description:
Optional. Used during import/export of settings.
Available since API v4.

clusterUrl.description:
Readonly. Link into the Cloudera Manager web UI for this specific cluster.

Available since API v10.

hostsUrl.description:
Readonly. Link into the Cloudera Manager web UI for host table for this cluster.

Available since API v11.

entityStatus.description:
Readonly. The entity status for this cluster.
Available since API v11.

uuid.description:
Readonly. The UUID of the cluster.

Available since API v15.

clusterType.description:
The type of cluster. If unspecified, defaults to either BASE_CLUSTER (if no data contexts are provided)
or COMPUTE_CLUSTER (if one or more data contexts are provided).
Available since APIv32.

tags.description:
Tags associated with the cluster.
Available since V41.

ApiCluster.description:
A cluster represents a set of interdependent services running on a set
of hosts. All services on a given cluster are of the same software version
(e.g. CDH4 or CDH5).

ApiClusterPerfInspectorArgs.title: ApiClusterPerfInspectorArgs

pingArgs.description:
Optional ping request arguments.
If not specified, default arguments will be used for ping test.

ApiClusterPerfInspectorArgs.description: Arguments used for the Cluster Performance Inspector

ApiClusterRef.title: ApiClusterRef

clusterName.description: The name of the cluster, which uniquely identifies it in a CM installation.

displayName.description: The display name of the cluster. This is available from v30.

ApiClusterRef.description:
A clusterRef references a cluster. To operate on the cluster object,
use the cluster API with the clusterName as the parameter.

products.description: All the parcels that needs to be deployed and activated

services.description: All the services that needs to be deployed

displayName.description: Cluster display name

cmVersion.description: CM version for which the template

instantiator.description:
A constructor listing all the variables and references that needs to be
resolved for this template

repositories.description: List of all repositories registered with CM

ApiClusterTemplateClusterSpec.title: ApiClusterTemplateClusterSpec
ApiClusterTemplateClusterSpec.description:
Specify type of cluster to create. If one or more ApiDataContextRef are specified, the created cluster
upon import will be a cluster with clusterType "COMPUTE".

ApiClusterTemplateConfig.title: ApiClusterTemplateConfig

name.description: Config name

ref.description:
Name of the reference. If referring to a service then it will be replaced
with actual service name at import time. If referring to a role then it
will be replaced with the host name containing that role at import time.

variable.description:
Referring a variable. The variable value will be provided by the user at
import time. Variable name for this config. At import time the value of
this variable will be provided by the
`   * #ApiClusterTemplateInstantiator.Variables

autoConfig.description: This indicates that the value was automatically configured.

ApiClusterTemplateConfig.description: Config Details: The config can either have a value or ref or variable.

ApiClusterTemplateHostInfo.title: ApiClusterTemplateHostInfo

hostNameRange.description: Host range. Either this this or host name must be provided.

hostTemplateRefName.description: Pointing to the host template reference in the cluster template.

roleRefNames.description:
This will used to resolve the roles defined in the cluster template. This
roleRefName will be used to connect this host with that a role reference
defined in cluster template.

ApiClusterTemplateHostInfo.description:
This contains information about the host or host range on which provided
host template will be applied.

ApiClusterTemplateHostTemplate.title: ApiClusterTemplateHostTemplate

cardinality.description: Represent the cardinality of this host template on source. Defaults to 0.

tags.description: The tags to be added to hosts when this template is applied

ApiClusterTemplateHostTemplate.description:
Host templates will contain information about the role config groups that
should be applied to a host. This basically means a host will have a role
corresponding to each config group.

hosts.description: All the hosts that are part of that cluster

variables.description: All the variables the are referred by the cluster template

roleConfigGroups.description: All the role config group informations for non-base RCGs.

keepHostTemplates.description: Keep the hosts templates from cluster template.

lenient.description:
Allow setting service parameters that may not currently be supported
by the current CM version but will be in the future.

ApiClusterTemplateRole.title: ApiClusterTemplateRole
ApiClusterTemplateRole.description:
Role info: This will contain information related to a role referred by some
configuration. During import type this role must be materizalized.

refName.description: The reference name of the role config.

base.description:
If true then it is the base config group for that role. There can only be
one base role config group for a given role type. Defaults to false.

displayName.description: Role config group display name

ApiClusterTemplateRoleConfigGroupInfo.title: ApiClusterTemplateRoleConfigGroupInfo

rcgRefName.description:
Role config group reference name. This much match the reference name from
the template.

name.description: Role config group name.

ApiClusterTemplateRoleConfigGroupInfo.description:
During import time information related to all the non-base config groups
must be provided.

refName.description:
Reference name of the service. This could be referred by some
configuration.

roleConfigGroups.description: All role config groups for that service

roles.description: List of roles for this service that are referred by some configuration.

displayName.description: Service display name.

ApiClusterTemplateVariable.title: ApiClusterTemplateVariable

name.description: Variable name that are referred in cluster template

value.description:
This value will be placed whereever the variable is referred in the cluster
template

ApiClusterTemplateVariable.description: Variable that is referred in cluster template.

ApiClusterUtilization.title: ApiClusterUtilization

totalCpuCores.description: Average number of CPU cores available in the cluster during the report window.

avgCpuUtilization.description:
Average CPU consumption for the entire cluster during the report window.
This includes consumption by user workloads in YARN and Impala, as well as
consumption by all services running in the cluster.

maxCpuUtilization.description:
Maximum CPU consumption for the entire cluster during the report window.
This includes consumption by user workloads in YARN and Impala, as well as
consumption by all services running in the cluster.

avgCpuDailyPeak.description:
Average daily peak CPU consumption for the entire cluster during the report
window. This includes consumption by user workloads in YARN and Impala, as
well as consumption by all services running in the cluster.

avgWorkloadCpu.description:
Average CPU consumption by workloads that ran on the cluster during the
report window. This includes consumption by user workloads in YARN and
Impala.

maxWorkloadCpu.description:
Maximum CPU consumption by workloads that ran on the cluster during the
report window. This includes consumption by user workloads in YARN and
Impala.

avgWorkloadCpuDailyPeak.description:
Average daily peak CPU consumption by workloads that ran on the cluster
during the report window. This includes consumption by user workloads in
YARN and Impala.

totalMemory.description:
Average physical memory (in bytes) available in the cluster during the
report window. This includes consumption by user workloads in YARN and
Impala, as well as consumption by all services running in the cluster.

avgMemoryUtilization.description:
Average memory consumption (as percentage of total memory) for the entire
cluster during the report window. This includes consumption by user
workloads in YARN and Impala, as well as consumption by all services
running in the cluster.

maxMemoryUtilization.description:
Maximum memory consumption (as percentage of total memory) for the entire
cluster during the report window. This includes consumption by user
workloads in YARN and Impala, as well as consumption by all services
running in the cluster.

avgMemoryDailyPeak.description:
Average daily peak memory consumption (as percentage of total memory) for
the entire cluster during the report window. This includes consumption by
user workloads in YARN and Impala, as well as consumption by all services
running in the cluster.

avgWorkloadMemory.description:
Average memory consumption (as percentage of total memory) by workloads
that ran on the cluster during the report window. This includes consumption
by user workloads in YARN and Impala.

maxWorkloadMemory.description:
Maximum memory consumption (as percentage of total memory) by workloads
that ran on the cluster. This includes consumption by user workloads in
YARN and Impala

avgWorkloadMemoryDailyPeak.description:
Average daily peak memory consumption (as percentage of total memory) by
workloads that ran on the cluster during the report window. This includes
consumption by user workloads in YARN and Impala.

tenantUtilizations.description: A list of tenant utilization reports.

maxCpuUtilizationTimestampMs.description:
Timestamp corresponding to maximum CPU utilization for the entire cluster
during the report window.

maxMemoryUtilizationTimestampMs.description:
Timestamp corresponding to maximum memory utilization for the entire
cluster during the report window.

maxWorkloadCpuTimestampMs.description:
Timestamp corresponds to maximum CPU consumption by workloads that
ran on the cluster during the report window.

maxWorkloadMemoryTimestampMs.description:
Timestamp corresponds to maximum memory resource consumption by workloads that
ran on the cluster during the report window.

errorMessage.description: Error message while generating utilization report.

ApiClusterUtilization.description: Utilization report information of a Cluster.

ApiClusterVersion.title: ApiClusterVersion
ApiClusterVersion.description: The CDH version of the cluster.

sourceCluster.description: Required name of the source cluster to run network diagnostics test.

targetCluster.description: Required name of the target cluster to run network diagnostics test.

pingArgs.description:
Optional ping request arguments.
If not specified, default arguments will be used for ping test.

bandwidthArgs.description:

Applicable since version v32.

Arguments used for the Cloudera Manager level performance inspector.

ApiCmPeer.title: ApiCmPeer

name.description: The name of the remote CM instance. Immutable during update.

type.description:
The type of the remote CM instance. Immutable during update.

Available since API v11.

url.description: The URL of the remote CM instance. Mutable during update.

username.description:
When creating peers, if 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is true, this should be
the remote admin username for creating a user in remote Cloudera Manager. The
created remote user will then be stored in the local Cloudera Manager DB and
used in later communication. If 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is false, which
is not applicable to REPLICATION peer type, Cloudera Manager will store this
username in the local DB directly and use it together with 'password' for
communication.

Mutable during update.
When set during update, if 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is true, a new user
in remote Cloudera Manager is created, the newly created remote user will be
stored in the local DB. An attempt to delete the previously created remote
user will be made; If 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is false, the
username/password in the local DB will be updated.

password.description:
When creating peers, if 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is true, this should be
the remote admin password for creating a user in remote Cloudera Manager. The
created remote user will then be stored in the local Cloudera Manager DB and
used in later communication. If 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is false, which
is not applicable to REPLICATION peer type, Cloudera Manager will store this
password in the local DB directly and use it together with 'username' for
communication.

Mutable during update.
When set during update, if 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is true, a new user
in remote Cloudera Manager is created, the newly created remote user will be
stored in the local DB. An attempt to delete the previously created remote
user will be made; If 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is false, the
username/password in the local DB will be updated.

clouderaManagerCreatedUser.description:
If true, Cloudera Manager creates a remote user using the given
username/password and stores the created user in local DB for use in later
communication. Cloudera Manager will also try to delete the created remote
user when deleting such peers.

If false, Cloudera Manager will store the provided username/password in
the local DB and use them in later communication. 'false' value on this
field is not applicable to REPLICATION peer type.

Available since API v11.

Immutable during update. Should not be set when updating peers.

createUserWithAdminRole.description:
If true and clouderaManagerCreatedUser is true, the created user will have admin role granted.

If false and clouderaManagerCreatedUser is true, the created user will have user role.

null means false.

Available since API v44.

Needs to be set during update if changing the URL.

ApiCmPeer.description:
Information about a Cloudera Manager peer instance.

The requirement and usage of username and password properties are dependent on the clouderaManagerCreatedUser flag.

When creating peers, if 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is true, the username/password should be the credentials of a user with administrator privileges on the remote Cloudera Manager. These credentials are not stored, they are used to connect to the peer and create a user in that peer. The newly created user is stored and used for communication with that peer. If 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is false, which is not applicable to REPLICATION peer type, the username/password to the remote Cloudera Manager are directly stored and used for all communications with that peer.

When updating peers, if 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is true and username/password are set, a new remote user will be created. If 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is false and username/password are set, the stored username/password will be updated.

If 'createUserWithAdminRole' is true and 'clouderaManagerCreatedUser' is true, the created internal user will also be granted admin role.

ApiCmPeerList.title: ApiCmPeerList
ApiCmPeerList.description: A list of Cloudera Manager peers.

ApiCmServer.title: ApiCmServer

name.description: The CM server hostname.

ApiCmServer.description:
This is the model for CM server information from v41.

The class models the host environment that CM server is installed. Each CM server instance
has an entry of CmServer entity and updates it periodically.

ApiCollectDiagnosticDataArguments.title: ApiCollectDiagnosticDataArguments

bundleSizeBytes.description: The maximum approximate bundle size of the output file. Defaults to 0.

startTime.description:
This parameter is ignored between CM 4.5 and CM 5.7 versions.
For versions from CM 4.5 to CM 5.7, use endTime and
bundleSizeBytes instead.

For CM 5.7+ versions, startTime is an optional parameter that
is with endTime and bundleSizeBytes. This was introduced
to perform diagnostic data estimation and collection of global
diagnostics data for a certain time range.
The start time (in ISO 8601 format)
of the period to collection statistics for.

endTime.description:
The end time (in ISO 8601 format)
of the period to collection statistics for.

includeInfoLog.description:
This parameter is ignored as of CM 4.5.
INFO logs are always collected.
Whether to include INFO level logs.
WARN, ERROR, and FATAL level logs are always included.

ticketNumber.description: The support ticket number to attach to this data collection.

comments.description: Comments to include with this data collection.

clusterName.description: Name of the cluster to collect. If null, collects from all clusters.

enableMonitorMetricsCollection.description: Flag to enable collection of metrics for chart display.

roles.description:
List of roles for which to get logs and metrics.

If set, this restricts the roles for log and metrics collection
to the list specified.

If empty, the default is to get logs for all roles (in the selected
cluster, if one is selected).

Introduced in API v10 of the API.

phoneHome.description:
Flag to enable or disable diagnostic bundle upload to EDH.

If not set, the PHONE_HOME setting decides whether the bundle will get uploaded or not.

ApiCollectDiagnosticDataArguments.description: Arguments used for the collectDiagnosticData command.

ApiCommand.title: ApiCommand

name.description: The command name.

endTime.description: The end time, if the command is finished.

active.description: Whether the command is currently active.

success.description: If the command is finished, whether it was successful.

resultMessage.description: If the command is finished, the result message.

resultDataUrl.description: URL to the command's downloadable result data, if any exists.

clusterRef.description: Reference to the cluster (for cluster commands only).

serviceRef.description: Reference to the service (for service commands only).

roleRef.description: Reference to the role (for role commands only).

hostRef.description: Reference to the host (for host commands only).

parent.description: Reference to the parent command, if any.

children.description:
List of child commands. Only available in the full view.

The list contains only the summary view of the children.

canRetry.description: If the command can be retried. Available since V11

ApiCommand.description:
Provides detailed information about a submitted command.

There are two types of commands: synchronous and asynchronous. Synchronous commands complete immediately, and their results are passed back in the returned command object after the execution of an API call. Outside of that returned object, there is no way to check the result of a synchronous command.

Asynchronous commands have unique non-negative IDs. They may still be running when the API call returns. Clients can check the status of such commands using the API.

ApiCommandMetadata.title: ApiCommandMetadata

name.description: The name of of the command.

argSchema.description:
The command arguments schema.

This is in the form of json schema and
describes the structure of the command
arguments. If null, the command does not
take arguments.

ApiCommandMetadata.description: Provides metadata information about a command.

items.description: The list of command metadata objects.

ApiCommissionState.description: Represents the Commission state of an entity.

ApiComponentInfo.title: ApiComponentInfo

name.description: The name of the component.

cdhVersion.description: The CDH version on the host.

componentInfoSource.description: Source from which component is taken.

isActive.description: returns true if component is active.

componentConfig.description: list of config name and value pair associated with component.

ApiComponentInfo.description: This is the model for a component in the host.

ApiConfig.title: ApiConfig

name.description: Readonly. The canonical name that identifies this configuration parameter.

value.description:
The user-defined value. When absent, the default value (if any)
will be used. Can also be absent, when enumerating allowed configs.

required.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
Whether this configuration is required for the object. If
any required configuration is not set, operations on the object may not
work.

default.description: Readonly. Requires "full" view. The default value.

displayName.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view. A user-friendly name of the parameters,
as would have been shown in the web UI.

description.description: Readonly. Requires "full" view. A textual description of the parameter.

relatedName.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view. If applicable, contains the related
configuration variable used by the source project.

sensitive.description:
Readonly.
Whether this configuration is sensitive, i.e. contains information such as passwords, which
might affect how the value of this configuration might be shared by the caller.

Available since v14.

validationState.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
State of the configuration parameter after validation.

validationMessage.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
A message explaining the parameter's validation state.

validationWarningsSuppressed.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
Whether validation warnings associated with this parameter are suppressed.
In general, suppressed validation warnings are hidden in the Cloudera
Manager UI. Configurations that do not produce warnings will not contain
this field.

ApiConfig.description: Model for a configuration parameter. When an entry's value property is not available, it means the entry is not configured. This means that the default value for the entry, if any, will be used. Setting a value to null also can be used to unset any previously set value for the parameter, reverting to the default value (if any).

ApiEnableJtHaArguments.title: ApiEnableJtHaArguments

newJtHostId.description: Id of host on which second JobTracker role will be added.

forceInitZNode.description:
Initialize the ZNode even if it already exists. This can happen if
JobTracker HA was enabled before and then disabled. Disable operation
doesn't delete this ZNode. Defaults to true.

zkServiceName.description:
Name of the ZooKeeper service that will be used for auto-failover.
This is an optional parameter if the MapReduce to ZooKeeper dependency is
already set in CM.

newJtRoleName.description: Name of the second JobTracker role to be created (Optional)

fc1RoleName.description:
Name of first Failover Controller role to be created.
This is the Failover Controller co-located with the current
JobTracker (Optional)

fc2RoleName.description:
Name of second Failover Controller role to be created.
This is the Failover Controller co-located with the new
JobTracker (Optional)

logicalName.description:
Logical name of the JobTracker pair. If value is not provided, "logicaljt" is used as the default. The name can contain only alphanumeric characters and "-".

Available since API v8.

ApiEnableJtHaArguments.description: Arguments used for enable JT HA command.

ApiEnableLlamaHaArguments.title: ApiEnableLlamaHaArguments

newLlamaHostId.description: HostId of the host on which the second Llama role will be created.

newLlamaRoleName.description: Name of the second Llama role to be created (optional).

zkServiceName.description:
Name of the ZooKeeper service that will be used for auto-failover.
This argument may be omitted if the ZooKeeper dependency for Impala
is already configured.

ApiEnableLlamaHaArguments.description: Arguments used for enable Llama HA command.

ApiEnableLlamaRmArguments.title: ApiEnableLlamaRmArguments

llama1HostId.description: HostId of the host on which the first Llama role will be created.

llama1RoleName.description: Name of the first Llama role to be created (optional).

llama2HostId.description: HostId of the host on which the second Llama role will be created.

llama2RoleName.description: Name of the second Llama role to be created (optional).

zkServiceName.description:
Name of the ZooKeeper service that will be used for auto-failover.
Only relevant when enabling Llama RM in HA mode (i.e., when two
Llama roles are being created). This argument may be omitted if
the ZooKeeper dependency for Impala is already configured.

skipRestart.description:
Skip the restart of Yarn, Impala, and their dependent services,
and don't deploy client configuration. Default is false (i.e.,
by default, the services are restarted and client configuration
is deployed).

ApiEnableLlamaRmArguments.description: Arguments used for enable Llama RM command.

ApiEnableNnHaArguments.title: ApiEnableNnHaArguments

activeNnName.description: Name of the NameNode role that is going to be made Highly Available.

standbyNnName.description:
Name of the new Standby NameNode role that will be created during the
command (Optional).

standbyNnHostId.description: Id of the host on which new Standby NameNode will be created.

standbyNameDirList.description:
List of directories for the new Standby NameNode.
If not provided then it will use same dirs as Active NameNode.

nameservice.description:
Nameservice to be used while enabling Highly Available.
It must be specified if Active NameNode isn't configured with it.
If Active NameNode is already configured, then this need not
be specified. However, if it is still specified, it must match
the existing config for the Active NameNode.

qjName.description:
Name of the journal located on each JournalNodes' filesystem.
This can be optionally provided if the config hasn't already been set for the
Active NameNode.
If this isn't provided and Active NameNode doesn't also have the config,
then nameservice is used by default. If Active NameNode already has this configured,
then it much match the existing config.

activeFcName.description:
Name of the FailoverController role to be created on
Active NameNode's host (Optional).

standbyFcName.description:
Name of the FailoverController role to be created on
Standby NameNode's host (Optional).

zkServiceName.description:
Name of the ZooKeeper service to be used for Auto-Failover.
This MUST be provided if HDFS doesn't have a ZooKeeper dependency.
If the dependency is already set, then this should be the name of the same
ZooKeeper service, but can also be omitted in that case.

jns.description:
Arguments for the JournalNodes to be created during the command.
Must be provided only if JournalNodes don't exist already in HDFS.

forceInitZNode.description:
Boolean indicating if the ZNode should be force initialized if it is
already present. Useful while re-enabling High Availability. (Default: TRUE)

clearExistingStandbyNameDirs.description:
Boolean indicating if the existing name directories for Standby NameNode
should be cleared during the workflow.
Useful while re-enabling High Availability. (Default: TRUE)

clearExistingJnEditsDir.description:
Boolean indicating if the existing edits directories for the JournalNodes
for the specified nameservice should be cleared during the workflow.
Useful while re-enabling High Availability. (Default: TRUE)

ApiEnableNnHaArguments.description: Arguments used for Enable NameNode High Availability command.

newOozieServerHostIds.description: IDs of the hosts on which new Oozie Servers will be added.

newOozieServerRoleNames.description:
Names of the new Oozie Servers. This is an optional argument,
but if provided, it should match the length of host IDs provided.

zkServiceName.description:
Name of the ZooKeeper service that will be used for Oozie HA.
This is an optional parameter if the Oozie to ZooKeeper dependency is
already set in CM.

loadBalancerHostname.description:
Hostname of the load balancer used for Oozie HA.
Optional if load balancer host and ports are already set in CM.

loadBalancerPort.description:
HTTP port of the load balancer used for Oozie HA.
Optional if load balancer host and ports are already set in CM.

loadBalancerSslPort.description:
HTTPS port of the load balancer used for Oozie HA when SSL is enabled.
This port is only used for oozie.base.url -- the callback is always
on HTTP.
Optional if load balancer host and ports are already set in CM.

loadBalancerHostPort.description:
Address of the load balancer used for Oozie HA.
This is an optional parameter if this config is already set in CM.

ApiEndPoint.title: ApiEndPoint

name.description: Name for the endPoint.

ApiEndPoint.description:
This defines a single logical service in the SDX cluster. A single service can expose one
or more URLs. This ApiEndPoint groups the URLs logically for configuration, versioning,
or any other service specific reason.

ApiEndPointHost.title: ApiEndPointHost
ApiEndPointHost.description: A host endPoint for a service.

ApiEntityStatus.title: ApiEntityStatus
ApiEntityStatus.description:
The single value used by the Cloudera Manager UI to represent the status of
the entity. It is computed from a variety of other entity-specific states,
not all values apply to all entities. For example, STARTING/STOPPING do not
apply to a host.

ApiEntityTag.title: ApiEntityTag
ApiEntityTag.description: Tag associated with an Entity in a Cloudera Manager instance

ApiEvent.title: ApiEvent

id.description: A unique ID for this event.

content.description: The content payload of this event.

timeReceived.description:
When the event was stored by Cloudera Manager. Events do not arrive in
the order that they are generated. If you are writing an event poller,
this is a useful field to query.

category.description:
The category of this event -- whether it is a health event, an audit
event, an activity event, etc.

alert.description: Whether the event is promoted to an alert according to configuration. Defaults to false

attributes.description: A list of key-value attribute pairs.

ApiEvent.description:
Events model noteworthy incidents in Cloudera Manager or the managed
Hadoop cluster. An event carries its event category, severity, and a
string content. They also have generic attributes, which are free-form
key value pairs. Important events may be promoted into alerts.

totalResults.description:
The total number of matched results. Some are possibly not shown due
to pagination.

ApiExternalAccount.title: ApiExternalAccount

name.description: Represents the intial name of the account; used to uniquely identify this account.

displayName.description: Represents a modifiable label to identify this account for user-visible purposes.

createdTime.description: Represents the time of creation for this account.

lastModifiedTime.description: Represents the last modification time for this account.

typeName.description:
Represents the Type ID of a supported external account type.
The type represented by this field dictates which configuration options must be defined
for this account.

accountConfigs.description:
Represents the account configuration for this account.

When an account is retrieved from the server,
the configs returned must match allowed configuration for the type of this account.

When specified for creation of a new account or for the update of an existing account,
this field must include every required configuration parameter specified in the type's definition,
with the account configuration's value field specified to represent the specific
configuration desired for this account.

ApiExternalAccount.description:
Represents an instantiation of an external account type, referencing a supported
external account type, via the typeName field, along with suitable configuration to
access an external resource of the provided type.

The typeName field must match the name of an external account type.

ApiExternalAccountCategory.title: ApiExternalAccountCategory

name.description: Represents an identifier for a category.

displayName.description: Represents a localized display name for a category.

description.description: Represents a localized description for a category.

ApiExternalAccountCategory.description: Type representing an external account category.

ApiExternalAccountCategoryList.title: ApiExternalAccountCategoryList
ApiExternalAccountCategoryList.description: Represents a list of external account categories.

ApiExternalAccountList.title: ApiExternalAccountList
ApiExternalAccountList.description: Represents a list of external accounts.

ApiExternalAccountType.title: ApiExternalAccountType

name.description: Represents the immutable name for this account.

categoryName.description: Represents the category of this account.

type.description: Represents the type for this account.

displayName.description: Represents the localized display name for this account.

description.description: Represents the localized description for this account type.

allowedAccountConfigs.description: Represents the list of allowed account configs.

ApiExternalAccountType.description:
A supported external account type.
An external account type represents an external authentication source that is used by
Cloudera Manager in its APIs to take suitable actions that require authentication to an
external service.

An external account type is uniquely identified by a server-generated ID and identifies with
a category identifier: e.g. The "AWS" category has an account type "AWS_Access_Key_Authorization"

ApiExternalAccountTypeList.title: ApiExternalAccountTypeList
ApiExternalAccountTypeList.description: Represents a list of external account types.

ApiExternalUserMapping.title: ApiExternalUserMapping

name.description: The name of the external mapping

type.description: The type of the external mapping

uuid.description: Readonly. The UUID of the authRole.

authRoles.description:
A list of ApiAuthRole that this user possesses.

Each custom role with be a built-in role with a set of scopes.
ApiAuthRole is the model for specifying custom roles.
Only admins and user admins can create/delete/update external
user mappings.

ApiExternalUserMapping.description: This is the model for external user mapping information in the API, v19 and beyond. These can be of 4 types : LDAP group, SAML, SAML attribute and External Script.

ApiExternalUserMappingList.title: ApiExternalUserMappingList
ApiExternalUserMappingList.description: A list of external user mappings.

uuid.description: The uuid of the external user mapping, which uniquely identifies it in a CM installation.

name.description: The name of the mapping.

ApiExternalUserMappingType.title: ApiExternalUserMappingType
ApiExternalUserMappingType.description: Enum for external user mapping types

ApiGenerateCmcaArguments.title: ApiGenerateCmcaArguments

location.description:
The location on disk to store the CMCA directory. If there is already a CMCA created there,
it will be backed up, and a new one will be created in its place.

customCA.description:
Whether to generate an internal CMCA (false) or use user-provided certificates (true).

When set to true (user-provided certificates), the following other arguments must be given:
* cmHostCert
* cmHostKey
* caCert
* keystorePasswd
* truststorePasswd

interpretAsFilenames.description:
Whether the following arguments are interpreted as filenames local to the Cloudera Manager
host (true, default) or as the actual data for that argument:
* cmHostCert
* cmHostKey
* caCert
* keystorePasswd
* truststorePasswd
* trustedCaCerts
* hostCerts.hostCert
* hostCerts.hostKey

If HTTPS has not been enabled on the Cloudera Manager Admin Console and API, we
*strongly* recommend that you pass the arguments as filenames local to the Cloudera Manager
host (i.e. set to true) to avoid leaking sensitive information over the wire in plaintext.

cmHostCert.description: The certificate for the CM host in PEM format. Only used if customCA == true.

cmHostKey.description: The private key for the CM host in PEM format. Only used if customCA == true.

caCert.description:
The certificate for the user-provided certificate authority in PEM format. Only used if
customCA == true.

keystorePasswd.description: The password used for all Auto-TLS keystores. Only used if customCA == true.

truststorePasswd.description: The password used for all Auto-TLS truststores. Only used if customCA == true.

trustedCaCerts.description:
A list of CA certificates that will be imported into the Auto-TLS truststore and
distributed to all hosts.

additionalArguments.description: A list of additional arguments that can be passed to the certificate manager

hostCerts.description:
A list of HostCertInfo objects, which associate a hostname with the corresponding
certificate and private key. Only used if customCA == true.

configureAllServices.description:
Whether to configure all existing services to use Auto-TLS. Defaults to false.

If false, only MGMT services will be configured to use Auto-TLS. Use the cluster-level
ConfigureAutoTlsServices command to configure Auto-TLS services for a single cluster only.

All future services will be configured to use Auto-TLS regardless of this setting.

ApiGenerateCmcaArguments.description: Arguments to generate a Cloudera Manager Certificate Authority (CMCA).

remoteRepoUrl.description: The url of the remote repository where the private cloud artifacts to install are hosted

dockerRegistry.description: The url of the Docker Registry where images required for install will be copied to

vaultAddr.description: Optional. The address the of external vault

ApiGenerateHostCertsArguments.description: Arguments to install certificates on a host

cmPeerNameOnRemote.description: The peer name of the local CM in the given sourceRef CM

ApiHBaseReplicationSetupStatus.title: ApiHBaseReplicationSetupStatus
ApiHBaseReplicationSetupStatus.description: Contains status info about the HBase replication first time setup

ApiHBaseShellCommand.title: ApiHBaseShellCommand
ApiHBaseShellCommand.description:
API request to execute generic hbase shell command

The payload (command) is passed as it is to hbase shell, so the caller needs to know the
exact syntax of the supported hbase shell command, based on underlying hbase version

tableName.description: Name of the table this snapshot is for.

storage.description: Whether the snapshot is local or remote.

The remote location where a snapshot is stored.

storage.description: Whether the snapshot is local or remote.

The regular expressions specifying the tables. Tables matching any of them
will be eligible for snapshot creation.

storage.description: The location where the snapshots should be stored.

processedTables.description:
The list of processed tables.
<p/>
This is only available in the full view.

unprocessedTables.description:
The list of unprocessed tables. Note that tables that are currently being
processed will also be included in this list.
<p/>

createdSnapshots.description:

creationErrorCount.description: Number of errors detected when creating snapshots.

ApiHdfsDisableHaArguments.title: ApiHdfsDisableHaArguments

activeName.description: Name of the the NameNode to be kept.

secondaryName.description: Name of the SecondaryNamenode to associate with the active NameNode.

startDependentServices.description: Whether to re-start dependent services. Defaults to true.

deployClientConfigs.description: Whether to re-deploy client configurations. Defaults to true.

disableQuorumStorage.description:
Whether to disable Quorum-based Storage. Defaults to false.

Available since API v2.

ApiHdfsDisableHaArguments.description: Arguments used for the HDFS disable HA command.

ApiHdfsFailoverArguments.title: ApiHdfsFailoverArguments

nameservice.description: Nameservice for which to enable automatic failover.

activeFCName.description: Name of the failover controller to create for the active NameNode.

standByFCName.description: Name of the failover controller to create for the stand-by NameNode.

ApiHdfsFailoverArguments.description: Arguments used when enabling HDFS automatic failover.

ApiHdfsHaArguments.title: ApiHdfsHaArguments

activeSharedEditsPath.description:
Path to the shared edits directory on the active NameNode's host.
Ignored if Quorum-based Storage is being enabled.

standBySharedEditsPath.description:
Path to the shared edits directory on the stand-by NameNode's host.
Ignored if Quorum-based Storage is being enabled.

nameservice.description: Nameservice that identifies the HA pair.

startDependentServices.description: Whether to re-start dependent services. Defaults to true.

deployClientConfigs.description: Whether to re-deploy client configurations. Defaults to true.

enableQuorumStorage.description:
This parameter has been deprecated as of CM 5.0, where HA is only supported using Quorum-based Storage.

Whether to enable Quorum-based Storage. Enabling Quorum-based Storage requires a minimum of three and an odd number of JournalNodes to be created and configured before enabling HDFS HA.

Available since API v2.

ApiHdfsHaArguments.description: Arguments used for HDFS HA commands.

mapreduceServiceName.description: The mapreduce service to use for the replication job.

schedulerPoolName.description:
Name of the scheduler pool to use when submitting the MapReduce job.
Currently supports the capacity and fair schedulers. The option is
ignored if a different scheduler is configured.

userName.description:
The user which will execute the MapReduce job. Required if running with
Kerberos enabled.

sourceUser.description:
The user which will perform operations on source cluster. Required if
running with Kerberos enabled.

numMaps.description: The number of mappers to use for the mapreduce replication job.

dryRun.description: Whether to perform a dry run. Defaults to false.

bandwidthPerMap.description:
The maximum bandwidth (in MB) per mapper in the mapreduce replication
job.

abortOnError.description: Whether to abort on a replication failure. Defaults to false.

removeMissingFiles.description:
Whether to delete destination files that are missing in source. Defaults
to false.

preserveReplicationCount.description: Whether to preserve the HDFS replication count. Defaults to false.

preserveBlockSize.description: Whether to preserve the HDFS block size. Defaults to false.

preservePermissions.description:
Whether to preserve the HDFS owner, group and permissions. Defaults to
false.
Starting from V10, it also preserves ACLs. Defaults to null (no preserve).
ACLs is preserved if both clusters enable ACL support, and replication
ignores any ACL related failures.

logPath.description: The HDFS path where the replication log files should be written to.

skipChecksumChecks.description:
Whether to skip checksum based file validation during
replication. Defaults to false.

skipListingChecksumChecks.description:
Whether to skip checksum based file comparison during
replication. Defaults to false.

skipTrash.description:
Whether to permanently delete destination files that are missing in source.
Defaults to null.

replicationStrategy.description:
The strategy for distributing the file replication tasks among the mappers
of the MR job associated with a replication. Default is
ReplicationStrategy#STATIC.

preserveXAttrs.description:
Whether to preserve XAttrs, default to false
This is introduced in V10. To preserve XAttrs, both CDH versions
should be >= 5.2. Replication fails if either cluster does not support
XAttrs.

exclusionFilters.description:
Specify regular expression strings to match full paths of files and directories
matching source paths and exclude them from the replication. Optional.
Available since V11.

raiseSnapshotDiffFailures.description:
Flag indicating if failures during snapshotDiff should be ignored or not.
When it is set to false then,
replication will fallback to full copy listing in case of any error in
snapshot diff handling and
it will ignore snapshot delete/rename failures at the end of a replication.
The flag is by default set to false in distcp tool which means it will ignore
snapshot diff failures and mark replication as success for snapshot
delete/rename failures.
In UI, the flag is set to true by default when source CM Version is greater than 5.14.

destinationCloudAccount.description: The cloud account name which is used in direct hive cloud replication, if specified.

ApiHdfsReplicationCounter.title: ApiHdfsReplicationCounter
ApiHdfsReplicationCounter.description: A counter in an HDFS replication job.

ApiHdfsReplicationResult.title: ApiHdfsReplicationResult

remainingTime.description: The time remaining for mapper phase (seconds).

estimatedCompletionTime.description: The estimated completion time for the mapper phase.

counters.description:
The counters collected from the replication job.
<p/>
Starting with API v4, the full list of counters is only available in the
full view.

numFilesDryRun.description: The number of files found to copy.

numBytesDryRun.description: The number of bytes found to copy.

numFilesExpected.description: The number of files expected to be copied.

numBytesExpected.description: The number of bytes expected to be copied.

numFilesCopied.description: The number of files actually copied.

numBytesCopied.description: The number of bytes actually copied.

numFilesSkipped.description:
The number of files that were unchanged and thus skipped during
copying.

numBytesSkipped.description: The aggregate number of bytes in the skipped files.

numFilesDeleted.description:
The number of files deleted since they were present at destination, but
missing from source.

numFilesCopyFailed.description: The number of files for which copy failed.

numBytesCopyFailed.description: The aggregate number of bytes in the files for which copy failed.

setupError.description: The error that happened during job setup, if any.

jobId.description:
Read-only. The MapReduce job ID for the replication job.
Available since API v4.
<p/>
This can be used to query information about the replication job from the
MapReduce server where it was executed. Refer to the "/activities"
resource for services for further details.

jobDetailsUri.description:
Read-only. The URI (relative to the CM server's root) where to find the
Activity Monitor page for the job. Available since API v4.

dryRun.description: Whether this was a dry run.

snapshottedDirs.description:
The list of directories for which snapshots were taken and used as part of
this replication.

runAsUser.description:
Returns run-as user name.
Available since API v11.

runOnSourceAsUser.description:
Returns run-as user name for source cluster.
Available since API v18.

logPath.description:
Returns HDFS path of DistCp execution log files.
Available since API v33.

failedFiles.description:
The list of files that failed during replication.
Available since API v11.

ApiHdfsReplicationResult.description: Detailed information about an HDFS replication job.

snapshotPath.description:
Read-only. Fully qualified path for the snapshot version of "path".
<p/>
For example, if a snapshot "s1" is present at "/a/.snapshot/s1, then the
snapshot path corresponding to "s1" for path "/a/b" will be
"/a/.snapshot/s1/b".

path.description: Path for which the snapshot error occurred.

snapshotName.description: Name of snapshot for which error occurred.

pathPatterns.description:
The path patterns specifying the paths. Paths matching any of them will be
eligible for snapshot creation.
<p/>
The pattern matching characters that can be specific are those supported
by HDFS. please see the documentation for HDFS globs for more details.

ApiHdfsSnapshotResult.title: ApiHdfsSnapshotResult

processedPaths.description:
The list of processed paths.
<p/>
This is only available in the full view.

unprocessedPaths.description:
The list of unprocessed paths. Note that paths that are currently being
processed will also be included in this list.
<p/>
This is only available in the full view.

createdSnapshots.description:
List of snapshots created.
<p/>
This is only available in the full view.

deletedSnapshots.description:
List of snapshots deleted.
<p/>
This is only available in the full view.

creationErrorCount.description: Number of errors detected when creating snapshots.

creationErrors.description:
List of errors encountered when creating snapshots.
<p/>
This is only available in the full view.

deletionErrorCount.description: Number of errors detected when deleting snapshots.

deletionErrors.description:
List of errors encountered when deleting snapshots.
<p/>
This is only available in the full view.

ApiHdfsSnapshotResult.description: Detailed information about an HDFS snapshot command.

ApiHdfsUpgradeDomainList.title: ApiHdfsUpgradeDomainList
ApiHdfsUpgradeDomainList.description:
A map from HDFS upgrade domains to host names, implemented as a list of
ApiMapEntryOfHostNameList objects, where the keys are upgrade domain strings and the values are
ApiHostNameList objects.

lastUpdateTime.description:
The time when HDFS usage info was last collected. No information
beyond this time can be provided.

items.description:
A list of per-user usage information at the requested
time granularity.

date.description: The date of the report row data.

size.description:
Total size (in bytes) of the files owned by this user. This does not
include replication in HDFS.

rawSize.description:
Total size (in bytes) of all the replicas of all the files owned by
this user.

numFiles.description: Number of files owned by this user.

ApiHealthCheck.title: ApiHealthCheck

name.description: Unique name of this health check.

summary.description: The summary status of this check.

explanation.description:
The explanation of this health check.
Available since v11.

suppressed.description:
Whether this health test is suppressed. A suppressed health test is not
considered when computing an entity's overall health.

ApiHive3ReplicationArguments.title: ApiHive3ReplicationArguments
ApiHive3ReplicationArguments.description: Replication Arguments for Hive3 schedules / policies

ApiHiveOnTezReplicationResult.title: ApiHiveOnTezReplicationResult

type.description:
Type of replication.
<p/>
BOOTSTRAP or INCREMENTAL

ApiHiveOnTezReplicationResult.description: Detailed information about a Hive replication job.

tableFilters.description:
Filters for tables to include in the replication. Optional. If not
provided, include all tables in all databases.

exportDir.description:
Directory, in the HDFS service where the target Hive service's data is
stored, where the export file will be saved. Optional. If not provided,
Cloudera Manager will pick a directory for storing the data.

force.description: Whether to force overwriting of mismatched tables. Defaults to false.

replicateData.description:
Whether to replicate table data stored in HDFS. Defaults to false.
<p/>
If set, the "hdfsArguments" property must be set to configure the
HDFS replication job.

hdfsArguments.description:
Arguments for the HDFS replication job.
<p/>
This must be provided when choosing to replicate table data stored in HDFS.
The "sourceService", "sourcePath" and "dryRun" properties of the HDFS
arguments are ignored; their values are derived from the Hive replication's
information.
<p/>
The "destinationPath" property is used slightly differently from the
usual HDFS replication jobs. It is used to map the root path of the
source service into the target service. It may be omitted, in which
case the source and target paths will match.
<p/>
Example: if the destination path is set to "/new_root", a "/foo/bar" path
in the source will be stored in "/new_root/foo/bar" in the target.

replicateImpalaMetadata.description:
Whether to replicate the impala metadata. (i.e. the metadata for impala
UDFs and their corresponding binaries in HDFS).

runInvalidateMetadata.description: Whether to run invalidate metadata query or not

dryRun.description: Whether to perform a dry run. Defaults to false

numThreads.description: Number of threads to use in multi-threaded export/import phase

impalaUDF.description: UDF signature, includes the UDF name and parameter types.

hiveUDF.description: Hive UDF signature, includes the UDF name and parameter types.

ApiHiveReplicationResult.title: ApiHiveReplicationResult

phase.description:
Phase the replication is in.
<p/>
If the replication job is still active, this will contain a string
describing the current phase. This will be one of: EXPORT, DATA or
IMPORT, for, respectively, exporting the source metastore information,
replicating table data (if configured), and importing metastore
information in the target.
<p/>
This value will not be present if the replication is not active.
<p/>
Available since API v4.

tableCount.description: Number of tables that were successfully replicated. Available since API v4.

tables.description:
The list of tables successfully replicated.

impalaUDFCount.description:

hiveUDFCount.description:

impalaUDFs.description:

hiveUDFs.description:

in the full view.

errorCount.description:
Number of errors detected during replication job.

errors.description:

dataReplicationResult.description: Result of table data replication, if performed.

dryRun.description: Whether this was a dry run.

runAsUser.description:

runOnSourceAsUser.description:

Available since API v33.

directoryForMetadata.description:
Returns HDFS path of export file for Hive replication.
Available since API v33.

statsAvailable.description:
Whether stats are available to display or not.

dbProcessed.description:
Number of Db's Imported/Exported.

tableProcessed.description:
Number of Tables Imported/Exported.

partitionProcessed.description:
Number of Partitions Imported/Exported.

functionProcessed.description:
Number of Functions Imported/Exported.

indexProcessed.description:
Number of Indexes Imported/Exported.
Available since API v19.

statsProcessed.description:
Number of Table and Partitions Statistics Imported/Exported.
Available since API v19.

dbExpected.description:
Number of Db's Expected.
Available since API v19.

tableExpected.description:
Number of Tables Expected.
Available since API v19.

partitionExpected.description:
Number of Partitions Expected.
Available since API v19.

database.description: Name of the database to which this table belongs.

tableName.description:
Name of the table. When used as input for a replication job, this can
be a regular expression that matches several table names. Refer to the
Hive documentation for the syntax of regular expressions.

database.description: Name of the database to which this UDF belongs.

ApiHost.title: ApiHost

hostId.description:
A unique host identifier.
This is not the same as the hostname (FQDN). It is a distinct
value that remains the same even if the hostname changes.

ipAddress.description: The host IP address. This field is not mutable after the initial creation.

hostname.description: The hostname. This field is not mutable after the initial creation.

rackId.description: The rack ID for this host.

lastHeartbeat.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
When the host agent sent the last heartbeat.

roleRefs.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
The list of roles assigned to this host.

healthSummary.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
The high-level health status of this host.

healthChecks.description:
Readonly. Requires "full" view.
The list of health checks performed on the host, with their results.

hostUrl.description:
Readonly.
A URL into the Cloudera Manager web UI for this specific host.

maintenanceMode.description:
Readonly. Whether the host is in maintenance mode.
Available since API v2.

commissionState.description:
Readonly. The commission state of this role.
Available since API v2.

maintenanceOwners.description:
Readonly. The list of objects that trigger this host to be in
maintenance mode.
Available since API v2.

numCores.description:
Readonly. The number of logical CPU cores on this host. Only populated
after the host has heartbeated to the server.
Available since API v4.

numPhysicalCores.description:
Readonly. The number of physical CPU cores on this host. Only populated
after the host has heartbeated to the server.
Available since API v9.

totalPhysMemBytes.description:
Readonly. The amount of physical RAM on this host, in bytes. Only
populated after the host has heartbeated to the server.
Available since API v4.

entityStatus.description:
Readonly. The entity status for this host.
Available since API v11.

clusterRef.description:
Readonly. A reference to the enclosing cluster. This might be null if the
host is not yet assigned to a cluster.
Available since API v11.

distribution.description:

tags.description:
Tags associated with the host.
Available since V41.

ApiHost.description: This is the model for a host in the system.

ApiHostCertInfo.title: ApiHostCertInfo

hostname.description: The FQDN of a host in the deployment.

certificate.description: The certificate for this host in PEM format.

key.description: The private key for this host in PEM format.

subjectAltNames.description: A list of alt names for a host.

ApiHostCertInfo.description: Associates a hostname with its corresponding certificate and private key

ApiHostInstallArguments.title: ApiHostInstallArguments

hostNames.description:
List of hosts to configure for use with Cloudera Manager.
A host may be specified by a hostname (FQDN) or an
IP address.

sshPort.description: SSH port. If unset, defaults to 22.

userName.description:
The username used to authenticate with the hosts.
Root access to your hosts is required to install Cloudera packages.
The installer will connect to your hosts via SSH and log in either
directly as root or as another user with password-less sudo
privileges to become root.

password.description:
The password used to authenticate with the hosts.
Specify either this or a private key.
For password-less login, use an empty string as
password.

privateKey.description:
The private key to authenticate with the hosts. Specify either this or a password.
The private key, if specified, needs to be a standard PEM-encoded key as a single string, with all line breaks replaced with the line-feed control character '\n'.
A value will typically look like the following string:
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\n[base-64 encoded key]\n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----

passphrase.description:
The passphrase associated with the private key
used to authenticate with the hosts (optional).

parallelInstallCount.description:
Number of simultaneous installations.
Defaults to 10. Running a large number of
installations at once can consume large
amounts of network bandwidth and other system
resources.

cmRepoUrl.description:
The Cloudera Manager repository URL to use (optional).
Example for SLES, Redhat or Debian based distributions:
https://archive.cloudera.com/cm6/6.0.0

gpgKeyCustomUrl.description:
The Cloudera Manager public GPG key (optional).
Example for SLES, Redhat or other RPM based distributions:
https://archive.cloudera.com/cm5/redhat/5/x86_64/cm/RPM-GPG-KEY-cloudera
Example for Ubuntu or other Debian based distributions:
https://archive.cloudera.com/cm5/ubuntu/lucid/amd64/cm/archive.key

javaInstallStrategy.description:
Added in v8: Strategy to use for JDK installation. Valid values are
1. AUTO: Cloudera Manager will install the JDK versions that are required when the "AUTO" option is selected. This package will be downloaded from Cloudera repository. This operation may overwrite any of the existing JDK installations.
2. NONE(default): Cloudera Manager will not install any JDK when "NONE" option is selected. It should be used if an existing JDK installation can be used. NOTE: Selecting the "NONE" option makes it the customer's responsibility to ensure that the unlimited strength JCE policy files are installed and enabled on each host, as appropriate for the version of Java in use.
3. OS_PROVIDED_JDK: Option added in v40, Cloudera Manager will install OpenJDK packages provided by the [non-cloudera] Operating System repositories configured on each host. This operation may overwrite any of the existing JDK installations.

unlimitedJCE.description:
Added in v8: Flag for unlimited strength JCE policy files installation If unset, defaults to false
Deprecated in CM 7.0.2: Flag for unlimited strength JCE policy files installation will be set to False. NOTE: With OpenJDK11 (and OpenJDK8 u232), JCE is installed and enabled by default.

gpgKeyOverrideBundle.description:
The Cloudera Manager public GPG key (optional). This points to the actual bundle contents
and not a URL.

agentReportedHostnames.description:
Optional. A map from hostname to reported_hostname value to be set in the
agent configuration file.

ApiHostInstallArguments.description:
Arguments to perform installation on one
or more hosts

ApiHostTemplate.title: ApiHostTemplate

name.description: The name of the host template. Unique across clusters.

clusterRef.description: Readonly. A reference to the cluster the host template belongs to.

roleConfigGroupRefs.description: The role config groups belonging to this host tempalte.

ApiHostTemplate.description:
A host template belongs to a cluster and contains a set of role config
groups for slave roles (such as DataNodes and TaskTrackers) from services
in the cluster. At most one role config group per role type can be present
in a host template. Host templates can be applied to fresh hosts (those with
no roles on them) in order to create a role for each of the role groups on
each host.

ApiHostsPerfInspectorArgs.title: ApiHostsPerfInspectorArgs

sourceHostList.description: Required list of host names which'll act as source for running network diagnostics test.

targetHostList.description: Required list of host names which'll act as target for running network diagnostics test.

pingArgs.description:
Optional ping request arguments.
If not specified, default arguments will be used for ping test.

ApiHostsPerfInspectorArgs.description:
Arguments used for the Cloudera Manager level performance inspector.
Network diagnostics will be run from every host in sourceHostList to every host
in targetHostList.

ApiHostsToRemoveArgs.title: ApiHostsToRemoveArgs
ApiHostsToRemoveArgs.description:
Arguments passed to the remove hosts from cluster api, every host passed in
has the roles in it deleted and the host is removed from the cluster,
but is still managed by CM.

If deleteHosts is set to true hosts are also deleted from CM.

ApiImpalaCancelResponse.title: ApiImpalaCancelResponse

warning.description: The warning response. If there was no warning this will be null.

ApiImpalaCancelResponse.description: The response from an Impala cancel query response.

statement.description: The SQL statement for the query.

queryType.description:
The query type. The possible values are: DML, DDL, QUERY and UNKNOWN.
See the Impala documentation for more details.

queryState.description:
The query state. The possible values are: CREATED, INITIALIZED, COMPILED,
RUNNING, FINISHED, EXCEPTION, and UNKNOWN.
See the Impala documentation for more details.

startTime.description: The time the query was issued.

endTime.description:
The time the query finished. If the query hasn't finished then this
will return null.

rowsProduced.description:
The number of rows produced by the query. If the query hasn't completed
this will return null.

attributes.description: A map of additional query attributes which is generated by Cloudera Manager.

user.description: The user who issued this query.

coordinator.description: The host of the Impala Daemon coordinating the query

detailsAvailable.description:
Whether we have a detailed runtime profile available for the query.
This profile is available at the endpoint /queries/{QUERY_ID}.

database.description: The database on which this query was issued.

durationMillis.description:
The duration of the query in milliseconds. If the query hasn't completed
then this will return null.

ApiImpalaQueryAttribute.title: ApiImpalaQueryAttribute

name.description:
The name of the attribute. This name can be used in filters, for example
'user' could be used in the filter 'user = root'.

type.description:
The type of the attribute. Valid types are STRING, NUMBER, BOOLEAN, BYTES,
MILLISECONDS, BYTES_PER_SECOND, BYTE_SECONDS.

displayName.description: The display name for the attribute.

supportsHistograms.description:
Whether the Service Monitor can generate a histogram of the distribution
of the attribute across queries.

ApiImpalaQueryAttributeList.description: The list of all the attributes that are applicable to Impala queries.

details.description:
The details for this query. Two formats are supported:
  • 'text': this is a text based, human readable representation of the Impala runtime profile.
  • 'thrift_encoded': this a compact-thrift, base64 encoded representation of the impala RuntimeProfile.thrift object. See the Impala documentation for more details.

warnings.description: This list of warnings for this response.

ApiImpalaQueryResponse.description: The response contains a list of queries and warnings.

ApiInstallControlPlaneArgs.title: ApiInstallControlPlaneArgs

kubernetesType.description: The kubernetes type (e.g. "openshift") that the control plane will run on

remoteRepoUrl.description: The url of the remote repository where the private cloud artifacts to install are hosted

valuesYaml.description: A yaml file containing configuration parameters for the installation. To see sample values.yaml files, read the documentation here.

kubeConfig.description:
The content of the kubeconfig file of the kubernetes environment on which the install will be performed Simplified example:

apiVersion: v1
clusters:
- cluster:
  certificate-authority-data: abc123
  server: https://example-server.domain.com:6443
 name: example-cluster.domain.com:6443
contexts:
- context:
  cluster: ocp-cluster1
  user: admin
 name: admin
current-context: admin
kind: Config
preferences: {}
users:
- name: admin
 user:
  client-certificate-data: abc123
  client-key-data: xyz987

For more information on the kubeconfig file, read the documentation here.

namespace.description: A unique namespace where the control plane will be installed

dockerRegistry.description:
The url of the Docker Registry where images required for install are hosted.

ApiParcel.title: ApiParcel

product.description: The name of the product, e.g. CDH, Impala

version.description: The version of the product, e.g. 1.1.0, 2.3.0.

stage.description:
Returns the current stage of the parcel.

There are a number of stages a parcel can be in. There are two types of stages - stable and transient. A parcel is in a transient stage when it is transitioning between two stable stages. The stages are listed below with some additional information.

  • AVAILABLE_REMOTELY: Stable stage - the parcel can be downloaded to the server.
  • DOWNLOADING: Transient stage - the parcel is in the process of being downloaded to the server.
  • DOWNLOADED: Stable stage - the parcel is downloaded and ready to be distributed or removed from the server.
  • DISTRIBUTING: Transient stage - the parcel is being sent to all the hosts in the cluster.
  • DISTRIBUTED: Stable stage - the parcel is on all the hosts in the cluster. The parcel can now be activated, or removed from all the hosts.
  • UNDISTRIBUTING: Transient stage - the parcel is being removed from all the hosts in the cluster>
  • ACTIVATING: Transient stage - the parcel is being activated on the hosts in the cluster. New in API v7
  • ACTIVATED: Steady stage - the parcel is set to active on every host in the cluster. If desired, a parcel can be deactivated from this stage.

state.description:
The state of the parcel. This shows the progress of state transitions
and if there were any errors.

clusterRef.description: Readonly. A reference to the enclosing cluster.

displayName.description: Read-only. Display name of the parcel. If set, available since v40.

description.description: Read-only. Description of the parcel. If set, available since v40.

ApiParcel.description:
A Parcel encapsulate a specific product and version. For example, (CDH 4.1). A parcel is downloaded, distributed to all the machines of a cluster and then allowed to be activated.

> The available parcels are determined by which cluster they will be running on. For example, a SLES parcel won't show up for a RHEL cluster.

ApiParcelRef.title: ApiParcelRef

clusterName.description: The name of the cluster that the parcel is used by.

parcelDisplayName.description: The display name of the parcel. If set, available since v40.

ApiParcelRef.description:
A parcelRef references a parcel. Each parcel is identified by its "parcelName"
and "parcelVersion", and the "clusterName" of the cluster that is using it.
To operate on the parcel object, use the API with the those fields as
parameters.

ApiParcelState.title: ApiParcelState

progress.description: The progress of the state transition.

totalProgress.description: The total amount that #getProgress() needs to get to.

count.description: The current hosts that have completed.

totalCount.description: The total amount that #getCount() needs to get to.

errors.description: The errors that exist for this parcel.

warnings.description: The warnings that exist for this parcel.

ApiParcelState.description:
The ApiParcelState encapsulates the state of a parcel while it is in transition and reports any errors that may have occurred..

The complete progress of a parcel is broken up into two different reporting indicators - progress and count. Progress is the primary indicator that reports the global state of transitions. For example, when downloading, progress and totalProgress will show the current number of bytes downloaded and the total number of bytes needed to be downloaded respectively.

The count and totalCount indicator is used when a state transition affects multiple hosts. The count and totalCount show the current number of hosts completed and the total number of hosts respectively. For example, during distribution, the progress and totalProgress will show how many bytes have been transferred to each host and the count will indicate how many hosts of of totalCount have had parcels unpacked.

Along with the two progress indicators, the ApiParcelState shows both errors and warnings that may have turned up during a state transition.
